Advertisement. To be Lett...A LARGE and COMMODIOUS FARM, pleasantly situated in Medford...produces plenty of the best English Hay, Salt-Hay, and Black-Grass, so called, (which last is esteemed very inferior to English Hay)...

Object Name
Text
Title
Advertisement. To be Lett...A LARGE and COMMODIOUS FARM, pleasantly situated in Medford...produces plenty of the best English Hay, Salt-Hay, and Black-Grass, so called, (which last is esteemed very inferior to English Hay)...
Date
1763-03-17
Author
Royall, Isaac, Esq.
Publisher
Boston News-Letter and the New England Chronicle
Place of publication
Boston, Massachusetts
Holding institution
Readex All Search
Source
infoweb.newsbank.com
Copyright
No known copyright restrictions.
Notes
loads of good English Hay, up to 20; pasture, and a great quantity of Salt Hay described within advertisement for a property rental or sale near the New Blazing-Star Ferry in Staten Island; property location in relation to existing road networks also emphasized; signed John Mercereau at the New Blazing Star Ferry.
